intro: Phyllanoa colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian phyllanoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentamerous flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
